intro: Fimbristylis kankaoensis, commonly known as the Kankao sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial grass-like plant characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, linear leaves. The plant produces spikes of tiny, pale green to brown flowers, typically in late summer or early autumn. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Fimbristylis kankaoensis is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams.
